channel.title: RuneScape Forums?
channel.description:
Well, I was wondering...
Do you think it is possible to make your very own RuneScape Forums by using Jagex's forum HTML code and using Java?
For example:
Right clicking and viewing their source? Then using Java for the pages to work or whatever?
I was wondering about this for 2 weeks. Just asking if this is possible? I do not know how to code or develop Java applications, I was just wondering if this is possible for someone to do?

item.title: RuneScape Forums?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

On another topic

jsp is a lot nicer looking, for one thing, and it compiles the pages instead of interpreting them every time, so its faster too.

You can server-side cache php files so some static pages don’t need to recompile each time the page is called. Take a look, cba atm.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape Forums?
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

io9:

Actually, I would believe its JaGEx’s implementation of some sort of SSS (server-side scripting), perhaps an extension of JSP?

Well, they do use Java Servlets for the world select page…

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape Forums?
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Exception:

Using JSP…Yeah, but why the hell use JSP, just use PHP. And no, it isn’t PHP, it’s some kind of secure cgi scripts, if it follows the rest of the website.

Actually, I would believe its JaGEx’s implementation of some sort of SSS (server-side scripting), perhaps an extension of JSP?

Read full topic
